page.title: 08Transport.
page.content: There is one main road passing through the block, the A386, the main road between Plymouth and Tavistock which still follows part of an ancient Bronze Age route out of Plymouth. A network of minor roads, country lanes and footpaths connect the farms, the estate etcetera, to the main road. The maintenance of the roads is the responsibility of County Council. The volume of traffic using the A386 means that it is checked by the Council Surveyor's Roads Dep't on a weekly basis. Other routes are checked on a monthly basis Maintenance of 'A' class road is funded by central government the maintenance of others from the County Council Rates. There is a regular half hourly bus service between Plymouth and Tavistock along the A386 providing the only alternative to private transport.
